greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Square array T(n,k), n >= 0, k >= 0, read by antidiagonals, where column k is the expansion of 1/(1 - 2*k*x + ((k-2)*x)^2)^(3/2).
mathematica: T[n_, k_] = 1/2 * Sum[If[k == 2 && n == j - 1, 1, (k - 2)^(n + 1 - j)] * j * Binomial[n + 1, j] * Binomial[n + 1 + j, j], {j, 1, n + 1}]; Table[Table[T[n, k - n], {n, 0, k}], {k, 0, 9}] //Flatten (* _Amiram Eldar_, Jan 20 2020 *)
program: matrix(7, 7, n, k, T(n-1, k-1)) \\ _Michel Marcus_, Jan 20 2020
results.author: _Seiichi Manyama_, Jan 19 2020
